title: 112_s3502
content: The Act titled the "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" applies motor vehicle safety standards to car rental companies. The "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" defines a covered rental vehicle as a motor vehicle rated at 26,000 pounds gross vehicle weight or less, rented without a driver for less than 4 months, and part of a fleet of 5 or more vehicles used for rental purposes by a rental company. The "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" defines a covered rental vehicle as a motor vehicle rated at 26,000 pounds gross vehicle weight or less, rented without a driver for less than 4 months, and part of a fleet of 5 or more vehicles used for rental purposes by a rental company. Rental companies must notify renters if a covered rental vehicle they are renting is subject to a safety recall. The "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" requires rental companies to inform renters and authorized drivers of any safety recalls on covered rental vehicles. The Secretary of Transportation cannot create regulations related to this until 3 years after the Act's enactment. Rental companies must also be notified by manufacturers about any covered rental vehicles with defects. The "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" amends certain sections related to rental companies and safety recalls. It includes provisions for rental companies to inform renters of safety recalls and prohibits making safety devices inoperative. The "Raechel and Jacqueline Houck Safe Rental Car Act of 2012" amends regulations regarding rental companies and safety recalls. It requires rental companies to inform renters of safety recalls and prohibits disabling safety devices. The amendments also expand inspection and reporting requirements to include rental companies. The Secretary of Transportation may conduct a study on the effectiveness of these changes. The amendments made by this section require rental companies to study the effectiveness of their activities related to motor vehicles subject to safety recalls. The amendments will take effect 60 days after the enactment of the Act.
